Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a plant that has water and appears healthy, showing it as green and upright.
The student can illustrate a plant without water, showing it as wilted or with drooping leaves.
The student can demonstrate, through the illustration, the idea that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can depict a comparison between plants that have water versus those without water to show observable differences.
The student can identify patterns in their drawing that show how water impacts plant health and growth.
